acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour LC50=27microg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Considering rabbit dermal LD50 value = 3160mg/kg (JMPR 448 (1978)), it was set as Category 5.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the lower one among rat inhalation LC50 (4 hours) = 0.054mg/L (RTECS (2003)) and LC50 (1 hour) = 2.76mg/L [4-hour conversion value 0.69mg/L] (HSDB (2003)), it was set as Category 2.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: The saturated concentration of this product is 6.43*10^(-4) ppm. Therefore, it is presumed that each inhalation test was performed in mist conditions. Since there is no data about steam, it cannot be classified.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat oral LD50 values (121.3 - 369mg/kg, number of data: 14) (JMPR 448 (1978)), we obtained the LD50 of 199.7mg/kg by calculation, and  we classified the substance as Category 3.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was the description (all are JMPR 883 (1994)) that liver adenomas (high-dose male rat) or a pituitary adenoma arises to a rat. But JMPR judged the carcinogenic negative in rat and mouse as a conclusion. Therefore, it considered as the outside of category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=2.78(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of experimental data, though "Flammable"

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There is the negative result of the in vivo small core test using mouse bone marrow cells (JMPR 883 (1994)), and it is classified as the out of the Category according to the technical guidelines.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at a room temperature and used as agricultural chemicals.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Although remarkable influence was not seen except that the slight skeletal abnormalities in the fetus were acknowledged in high doses in the rabbit teratogenicity studies on the of Priority 1 (JMPR 883 (1994)), some influence on reproduction ability (decline in copulation rate and fertilization rates) was seen in the two-generation examination on rats (JMPR 883 (1994)). So it was set as Category 2.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is description which indicates the irritation against the human eyes by Priority 2 (ICSC (J) (1997), and SITTIG (4th, 2002)), in addtion, the irritation was set to "mildly" (HSDB (2003)). So it was set as Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is description which indicates irritant in Priority 2 (HSDB (2003), SITTIG (4th, 2002)). But there is no specific information, Moreover, the irritation was set to "mildly" in HSDB (2003), it was thought that irritant was slight, and it was set as 3.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (the water solubility is obtained)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since in Priority 1 (JMPR 883 (1994)), to humans (spraying working personnel of this substance), although it is reversible, the neuromuscular dysfunction and ultrastructure defects of motor end plates are observed and moreover, in the experiment of the rat in Priority 1(JMPR 883(1994)),  since the effects on the liver was observed within the limits of Category 2 of a guidance value, it was classified into Category 1 (nervous systems) and Category 2 (liver).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since in Priority 2, there is description of "a nervous systems may be affected" to humans (ICSC (J) (1997), SITTIG (4th, 2002), in addition, effect on a nervous system also in the experimental to the male rat of JMPR 448 (1979) is observed, (however, since original literature is old and the detailed experimental condition are unknown, application of a guidance value cannot be performed), it was considered as Category 2 (nervous system).
